content.text:
I'll help you warm up by exploring the current directory structure and understanding what we're working with.

Let me start by examining the contents of the working directory:

<Bash>
ls -la
</Bash>

Let me also check what type of files we have in this directory using glob patterns:

<Glob>
*.*
</Glob>

And let me see if there are any subdirectories:

<Glob>
*/
</Glob>

Now let me get a better understanding of the file types and sizes:

<Bash>
find . -type f -name "*" | head -20
</Bash>

Let me also check if there are any common file extensions:

<Bash>
find . -type f -name "*.html" -o -name "*.css" -o -name "*.js" -o -name "*.json" -o -name "*.txt" -o -name "*.xml" | head -10
</Bash>
